lines.text: Presence of many atoms broadens energy levels into bands
Electron moves to higher energy level
Electron returns to lower energy state

secText:
Lesson:
1. Describe the energy levels of an atom using an [OBJ:expsec_x467:energy diagram].
2. Identify the energy band diagrams of [OBJ:expsec_x468:insulators and conductors].
3. Identify the energy band diagram of a [OBJ:expsec_x470:semiconductor]. Compare and contrast the energy band diagrams of insulators, conductors, and semiconductors.
4. Describe [OBJ:expsec_x470:doping] using energy band diagrams.
5. Define [OBJ:expsec_x470:diodes].
6. Identify the components of a [OBJ:expsec_x475:transistor].
7. Apply the concept of semiconductors to [OBJ:expsec_x476:transistors].
8. Apply the concept of semiconductors to [OBJ:expsec_x477:photovoltaic cells].
9. Define [OBJ:expsec_x477:lasers].
10. Describe how a [OBJ:pwsec_x480:laser works].
